dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Mohammad Nabi b Dawlat Zadran 83 (87b 4x4 1x6 148m) SR: 95.4

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiqur's superb effort ends with a skier to Nabi at extra cover! It was in the slot full outside off, just got under it way too much trying to clear the off side ring. Goes high to Nabi backpedaling from the circle and he takes it safely. Mushfiqur has set up Bangladesh beautifully on a track offering plenty of turn. Every run valuable on what is expected to be a tough chasing track used for a second match.

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 51 (69b 1x4 0x6 99m) SR: 73.91

dismissalComment.html: he's got him! Shakib not reviewing. Length ball skids past the inside edge as he gets forward and raps him in front of middle stump. Was that angling down? Could have been, but Shakib doesn't think so. And he's right, replays confirm. Walks straight off. Mujeeb has done it. He has quietly had a very good World Cup. Today he's made an opening. Shakib was playing for the offbreak, this cut back in

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full on off, drives in the air to short cover and Afghanistan are claiming a catch! Watching live I thought it definitely short hopped and Liton is standing his ground. Hashmatullah Shahidi is the fielder. It's 50/50. He lunged forward and the ball lodged in his right hand with his left hand coming off. His head was up high, didn't look at the ball going in to protect his face so he may genuinely not have known if it carried or not. And the third umpire has decided it is OUT! Third umpire is Aleem Dar. The soft signal on field was out and he said he didn't see anything conclusive to overturn on the mic'd up conversation. Those kinds of catches are regularly overturned. It'll generate plenty of debate for sure. It looked awkward at any rate as both hands were not under the ball, just the right one.

he's got him! Shakib not reviewing. Length ball skids past the inside edge as he gets forward and raps him in front of middle stump. Was that angling down? Could have been, but Shakib doesn't think so. And he's right, replays confirm. Walks straight off. Mujeeb has done it. He has quietly had a very good World Cup. Today he's made an opening. Shakib was playing for the offbreak, this cut back in

lbw decision review by Sarkar. He's caught right in front of middle to a full ball, trying to flick it. It's a legbreak this time. Has it done enough to miss leg? The stump is half visible on the early replay...and tracking says it is clipping it. Umpire's call. Bangladesh retain their review, but they've lost Sarkar - who already looked quite lost at No. 5. Liton was probably pushed up today to counter Mujeeb, and we've seen why

another slower ball does the trick! Full marks to Gulbadin for the constant variations which stymied both batsmen this over. This one lands on a good length on the stumps but Mahmudullah's timing is off trying to charge and he mistimes a pull straight to Nabi five yards in from the ring at midwicket, taken at thigh height while crouching his left knee on the turf.

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: slower ball yorker finally rewarded! It was loopy at 99 kph/61 mph. Mosaddek backed away to carve over the off side but couldn't time this trying to swat over the top of it as the ball fell off a table. Toe edge drags the ball onto off stump.

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 16 (17b 2x4 0x6 20m) SR: 94.11

dismissalText.long: b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Mohammad Nabi 36 (53b 4x4 0x6 62m) SR: 67.92

dismissalComment.html: castled! Nabi with the rope a dope the ball before floating up a sucker ball to get Tamim on the back foot, this time zips one in slightly quicker and flatter on a good to fullish length at 82 kph/51 mph, Tamim into the habit of consistently going onto the back foot when he should've come forward for this, this one skids on from fourth stump line to crash into off stump, beating the back foot slap. Bangladesh momentum arrested temporarily.

dismissalText.long: c Liton Das b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Gulbadin Naib c Liton Das b Shakib Al Hasan 47 (75b 3x4 0x6 107m) SR: 62.66

dismissalComment.html: brilliant field placing captaincy by Mashrafe! They had a man at short mid-off a little while ago and Liton was moved a touch wider at short extra cover at about 17 yards. The ball has been stopping a touch on this pitch all day with flicks and drives going slightly uppish in the ring and on this occasion Gulbadin laces a flat drive to Liton, who claims a catch at ankle height crouching slightly forward. Shakib erupts, as does the partisan Bangladesh crowd! 8/10 on degree of difficulty due to the pace it came at Liton from short range but it was straight to him on line.

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken at mid-on. That is a soft dismissal for Afghanistan's best player. Length ball skids on with the arm at off stump. He looks to pull uppishly with the front leg in the leg side. Ends up slicing weakly for the fielder tracking back there

brilliant field placing captaincy by Mashrafe! They had a man at short mid-off a little while ago and Liton was moved a touch wider at short extra cover at about 17 yards. The ball has been stopping a touch on this pitch all day with flicks and drives going slightly uppish in the ring and on this occasion Gulbadin laces a flat drive to Liton, who claims a catch at ankle height crouching slightly forward. Shakib erupts, as does the partisan Bangladesh crowd! 8/10 on degree of difficulty due to the pace it came at Liton from short range but it was straight to him on line.

Bangladesh's king of the tourney castles the President of Afghanistan! It was a beauty flighted on fourth stump and skidded on with Nabi's technique exposed. He gave a half-hearted stride forward prodding with a gap between bat and pad. The ball clips the inside edge before ricocheting onto leg stump. Shakib is rocking this tournament!

Shakib you monster! Asghar was bogged down and looked desperate to get off strike previous ball. He shuffles back and forth side to side across the crease as Shakib approached this time and finally stopped moving with his feet outside leg stump as Shakib floated one full on middle. Asghar goes for the slog sweep as a release shot in frustration, too much elevation and not enough distance. Basic catch taken at waist height 8 yards in from the rope.

five-for! Shakib Al Hasan, yet again. What a player. Arm ball, at a length outside off. It floats away. Najib runs down the pitch...and eventually right past the ball. No chance of coming back after missing on this attempted slog

dismissalText.long: st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain 11 (31b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 35.48

dismissalComment.html: lovely flight and lovely stumping! Hashmatullah had itchy feet from the start of the over with a series of premeditated shuffles down the pitch. He got the itch again tempted out with a well flighted ball that was dragged slightly back and slightly wider on a fifth stump line. Hashmatullah doesn't cover the line and is beaten by the turn. Sharp work by Mushfiqur to whip the bails off with Hashmatullah's back foot flailing about three inches short of getting back in.

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.32pm And that is all from our coverage. Thanks for joining us! On behalf of Thilak, Saurabh, and Peter, this is goodbye.

Mashrafe: The crowd has been fanatstic throughout this tournament.Shakib's been fantastic. He's scoring runs and whenever we need he's getting us wickets. I think that partnership wasn't very big but Mushy and Shakib partnership was important. Tamim batted well and Riyadh's innings was important. I think the physio will take a call later on him. Still one week left, so he could be alright. We will try our level best (against Pakistan and India), that's all I can say to the fans.

Gulbadin: Obviously we played tough games the last two games. Today we missed something in the fielding, 30-40 runs extra. The wicket was slow, it helped the spinners. But it wasn't that helpful in second innings. Credit to Shakib.
[Najib at 8] He hits it strongly, we thought it would be nice to send Ikram to take singles and keep it ticking.
I think we missed something this tournament, with things like injuries. We're missing something.

Shakib: Yes it's been great throughout this WC. Luckily we started well so the fans have been behind us. I think the five wickets gave me greater pleasure. I had to work really hard for the fifty. Mushfiq played an important knock, without him we wouldn't have got the runs. We knew it was going to be tough with their three spinners, so it needed a team effort. I did work really hard before the WC, I was well prepared. The best I could ever be prepared. It's paying off. Definitely want it to carry on. Our next two games against India and Pakistan are big games.
Shakib Al Hasan is the Man of the Match.

Shabd Wahal: "Top 7 teams points tally reads like this-11,10,9,8,7,6,5. The countdown has begun for the semifinal spot. Excited."

Tariq: "Shinwari was left stranded on 49. No wonder he is frustrated "

Shabd Wahal: "Bangladesh matches no longer David Vs Goliath against top teams. It's fight of equals and no longer be termed as upset anymore."

Ovy: "This is Shakib's world. We're just living in it! "

6:14pm A win by 62 runs. Shakib at it again. Big grin as he walks off and shakes hands. What a herculean World Cup performance it has been so far. Already good enough to go down as one of the best ever. A fifty and five-for for him today. He is yet to have an average day this tournament. Bangladesh haven't had too many average days either. They keep marching on as vigorously as they have been all tournament long. Clipping at the heels of England now in fifth place.

commentPreTextItems.html: Zunaid Kazi: "Arun on Sakib /long way to go to be best ever. Having been too all rounder in all forms of the game for years, what else does Sakib need to do? Walk on water?"

commentTextItems.html: full and just outside off, tapped to extra cover
bouncer at off stump, looks to pull, sliced into the empty square leg area
yorker length outside off, digs this out viciously and gets it past the bowler. Shakib slides after sprinting to his right at long-off but can't stop it cleanly
full on middle stump, flicked to long-on
yorker just outside off, beaten as he tries to run it to third man
short of a length and rising over off stump as he looks to poke through the off side

commentPostTextItems.html:
Arun : "Shakib may well be the best all rounder after Kallis. Long way to go to become the best ever! "

Kiran Nawathe: "With such impactful performance, Shakib really deserves to be player of the Tournament, even if Bangladesh doesn't qualify for Semis. As Lance klusener was in 1999 WC"

commentPreTextItems.html: Mashur: "@Susam: If Shakib doesn't get that recognition then nobody would ever be able to get that. Tell me what he can't do. I will wait! The superstar! The myth! The legend! Unbelievably extraordinary!"

commentTextItems.html: beaten. Length ball cuts away outside off as he pokes on the front foot
length on off stump, tapped into the covers
short ball at the ribs, pulls uppishly to deep midwicket's right
length ball drifted up at off stump, watchfully defended into the covers

commentPostTextItems.html: Applause around the ground for a top spell from a top player.

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short of a length just outside off, tapped to extra cover's right off the back foot
length on leg stump, pings off the inside edge as he gets forward to defend
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine

commentPreTextItems.html: Susam : "Is Sakib Al Hasan in the list of worlds best all rounders (All time)???? Will the world give him that respect... " --- A yes from me

commentTextItems.html: length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, tapped into the midwicket region with soft hands
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot

commentPostTextItems.html: I'd spoken to Shakib Al Hasan in April when he was here for the IPL. In talking about spin, he said fingerspinners aren't any less dangerous than wristspinners are - as long as they're willing to flight the ball. Here is that interview.

commentTextItems.html: offcutter, short of a length and wide outside off. Looks to cut and gets a thick outside edge that lands short of wide slip

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 16 (17b 2x4 0x6 20m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: full on off, drives in the air to short cover and Afghanistan are claiming a catch! Watching live I thought it definitely short hopped and Liton is standing his ground. Hashmatullah Shahidi is the fielder. It's 50/50. He lunged forward and the ball lodged in his right hand with his left hand coming off. His head was up high, didn't look at the ball going in to protect his face so he may genuinely not have known if it carried or not. And the third umpire has decided it is OUT! Third umpire is Aleem Dar. The soft signal on field was out and he said he didn't see anything conclusive to overturn on the mic'd up conversation. Those kinds of catches are regularly overturned. It'll generate plenty of debate for sure. It looked awkward at any rate as both hands were not under the ball, just the right one.

dismissalText.long: b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Mohammad Nabi 36 (53b 4x4 0x6 62m) SR: 67.92

dismissalComment.html: castled! Nabi with the rope a dope the ball before floating up a sucker ball to get Tamim on the back foot, this time zips one in slightly quicker and flatter on a good to fullish length at 82 kph/51 mph, Tamim into the habit of consistently going onto the back foot when he should've come forward for this, this one skids on from fourth stump line to crash into off stump, beating the back foot slap. Bangladesh momentum arrested temporarily.

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 51 (69b 1x4 0x6 99m) SR: 73.91

dismissalComment.html: he's got him! Shakib not reviewing. Length ball skids past the inside edge as he gets forward and raps him in front of middle stump. Was that angling down? Could have been, but Shakib doesn't think so. And he's right, replays confirm. Walks straight off. Mujeeb has done it. He has quietly had a very good World Cup. Today he's made an opening. Shakib was playing for the offbreak, this cut back in

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Mohammad Nabi b Dawlat Zadran 83 (87b 4x4 1x6 148m) SR: 95.4

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiqur's superb effort ends with a skier to Nabi at extra cover! It was in the slot full outside off, just got under it way too much trying to clear the off side ring. Goes high to Nabi backpedaling from the circle and he takes it safely. Mushfiqur has set up Bangladesh beautifully on a track offering plenty of turn. Every run valuable on what is expected to be a tough chasing track used for a second match.

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 3 (10b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: lbw decision review by Sarkar. He's caught right in front of middle to a full ball, trying to flick it. It's a legbreak this time. Has it done enough to miss leg? The stump is half visible on the early replay...and tracking says it is clipping it. Umpire's call. Bangladesh retain their review, but they've lost Sarkar - who already looked quite lost at No. 5. Liton was probably pushed up today to counter Mujeeb, and we've seen why

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Gulbadin Naib
dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Mohammad Nabi b Gulbadin Naib 27 (38b 2x4 0x6 52m) SR: 71.05

dismissalComment.html: another slower ball does the trick! Full marks to Gulbadin for the constant variations which stymied both batsmen this over. This one lands on a good length on the stumps but Mahmudullah's timing is off trying to charge and he mistimes a pull straight to Nabi five yards in from the ring at midwicket, taken at thigh height while crouching his left knee on the turf.

dismissalText.long: c Liton Das b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Gulbadin Naib c Liton Das b Shakib Al Hasan 47 (75b 3x4 0x6 107m) SR: 62.66

dismissalComment.html: brilliant field placing captaincy by Mashrafe! They had a man at short mid-off a little while ago and Liton was moved a touch wider at short extra cover at about 17 yards. The ball has been stopping a touch on this pitch all day with flicks and drives going slightly uppish in the ring and on this occasion Gulbadin laces a flat drive to Liton, who claims a catch at ankle height crouching slightly forward. Shakib erupts, as does the partisan Bangladesh crowd! 8/10 on degree of difficulty due to the pace it came at Liton from short range but it was straight to him on line.

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Tamim Iqbal b Shakib Al Hasan 24 (35b 3x4 0x6 45m) SR: 68.57

dismissalComment.html: taken at mid-on. That is a soft dismissal for Afghanistan's best player. Length ball skids on with the arm at off stump. He looks to pull uppishly with the front leg in the leg side. Ends up slicing weakly for the fielder tracking back there

dismissalText.long: st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mosaddek Hossain 11 (31b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 35.48

dismissalComment.html: lovely flight and lovely stumping! Hashmatullah had itchy feet from the start of the over with a series of premeditated shuffles down the pitch. He got the itch again tempted out with a well flighted ball that was dragged slightly back and slightly wider on a fifth stump line. Hashmatullah doesn't cover the line and is beaten by the turn. Sharp work by Mushfiqur to whip the bails off with Hashmatullah's back foot flailing about three inches short of getting back in.

dismissalText.long: c sub (Sabbir Rahman) b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan c sub (Sabbir Rahman) b Shakib Al Hasan 20 (38b 1x4 0x6 44m) SR: 52.63

dismissalComment.html: Shakib you monster! Asghar was bogged down and looked desperate to get off strike previous ball. He shuffles back and forth side to side across the crease as Shakib approached this time and finally stopped moving with his feet outside leg stump as Shakib floated one full on middle. Asghar goes for the slog sweep as a release shot in frustration, too much elevation and not enough distance. Basic catch taken at waist height 8 yards in from the rope.

dismissalText.long: b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh's king of the tourney castles the President of Afghanistan! It was a beauty flighted on fourth stump and skidded on with Nabi's technique exposed. He gave a half-hearted stride forward prodding with a gap between bat and pad. The ball clips the inside edge before ricocheting onto leg stump. Shakib is rocking this tournament!

dismissalText.long: not out
dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari not out 49 (51b 3x4 1x6 90m) SR: 96.07

dismissalComment.html: appeal for lbw is turned down, appeal for run-out is sent upstairs. He was looking to flick this length ball from middle stump and deflected it into the leg side...and Ikram has made a lazy attempt to get back in at the non-striker's end. Just plonks it in and the direct hit has caught him short. It was a poor run attempt to start off, but the end could have been so different

dismissalComment.html: five-for! Shakib Al Hasan, yet again. What a player. Arm ball, at a length outside off. It floats away. Najib runs down the pitch...and eventually right past the ball. No chance of coming back after missing on this attempted slog

He shuffles back and forth side to side across the crease as Shakib approached this time and finally stopped moving with his feet outside leg stump as Shakib floated one full on middle. Asghar goes for the slog sweep as a release shot in frustration, too much elevation and not enough distance. Basic catch taken at waist height 8 yards in from the rope.

five-for! Shakib Al Hasan, yet again. What a player. Arm ball, at a length outside off. It floats away. Najib runs down the pitch...and eventually right past the ball. No chance of coming back after missing on this attempted slog

dismissalText.commentary: Gulbadin Naib c Liton Das b Shakib Al Hasan 47 (75b 3x4 0x6 107m) SR: 62.66

dismissalComment.html: brilliant field placing captaincy by Mashrafe! They had a man at short mid-off a little while ago and Liton was moved a touch wider at short extra cover at about 17 yards. The ball has been stopping a touch on this pitch all day with flicks and drives going slightly uppish in the ring and on this occasion Gulbadin laces a flat drive to Liton, who claims a catch at ankle height crouching slightly forward. Shakib erupts, as does the partisan Bangladesh crowd! 8/10 on degree of difficulty due to the pace it came at Liton from short range but it was straight to him on line.

seriesStandings.notes:
League Stage
In the event of teams finishing on equal points
* The team with the most wins in the League Stage will be placed in the higher position.
* If there are teams with equal points and equal wins in the League Stage then in such case the teams will be ordered according to their net run rate in the League Stage matches.
* If there are teams that are still equal, they will be ordered according to the result(s) of the head to head match(es) played between them (points, then if still equal, net run rate in those matches).
* If the above does not resolve the League Stage ordering and there are teams that are still equal, the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings.
* If all matches in the League Stage produce no results the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings and the top 4 seeded teams will progress to Semi-Finals.
Semi Final
If a Semi-Final is tied, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team progresses to the Final.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, then the team which proceeds to the Final will be the team that finished in the higher position in the League Stage.
Final
In the event of a tied final, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team is the winner.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, the teams shall be declared joint winners.
